New Records: Tarik Skubal struck out six batters and did not allow an earned run over six innings to help lift the Tigers to a 3-1 victory over the Houston Astros.
Key Match Events: The Tigers defeated the Astros in Game 1 of an AL Wild Card Series, earning their first playoff win over a decade.
Yainer Diaz's RBI single in the ninth inning brought the Astros within one run, but they were unable to score further.
Beau Brieske came on in relief with one out in the ninth and retired Victor Caratini and Chas McCormick to record the save.
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers hoped Skubal's stellar performance from the regular season would carry over into the MLB postseason.
Post-Match Reflections: Skubal said, 'It was a good challenge. It was fun. It was a ton of fun. I enjoyed it. It’s probably the most nervous I’ve been since my debut.'
Astros manager Joe Espada said, 'We had a few chances there in the middle of the game, and we couldn’t capitalize. But credit to him. He made pitches. And we battled until the end.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros are in the playoffs for a franchise-record eighth straight year.
The game marked the Astros' 98th postseason game since 2017.
The Tigers' win marked the first postseason victory for the team since Game 4 of the AL championship series in 2013.
Others: The second game of the best-of-three series is scheduled for Wednesday in Houston.
